outputs.output_descr: National Institutions utilize Results-Based Management  (RBM) systems for planning, monitoring and evaluation to enhance ownership and leadership for achievemnet of development results. RBM Practices will be the strategy through which the Joint Programme will ensure that the planning, management, monitoring, evaluation, reporting and accountability arrangements focus on results. RBM will be embedded in all activities supported through the programme.

Ministry of Finance, Ministry of Economic Planning and Office of the President and Cabinet have been assessed as having sufficient capacities to implement the project. Support will be provided to ensure effective and efficient delivery of results, timely preparation of annual work plans and budgets and Joint Programme Steering Committee (JPSC), Programme Management Coordination (PMC) and Technical Working Group (TWG) meetings, as well as mid-and end-term evaluation and required audits.

project_descr: Public institutions are better able to manage, allocate and utilize resources for effective development and service delivery by 2016
